text: All should keep clear of this vile place
They are the rightful owners, let us restore control of these land to them
They are the rightful owners, let us restore control of these land to them
They are the rightful owners, let us restore control of these land to them
Such a reward proves they will protect these lands, we cede control of these land to them
They are old and trusted friends, these lands will be safe under their stewardship
We have taken back this den of foulness, local rulers now vie for it's control each with their own rewards.\\n\\nThe decision is yours to make Commander.
A noble on a diplomatic mission has been kidnapped. Their incredibly wealthy family wants you to track down the assailant and bring the noble back unharmed.
We have more important matters to attend to
Our caravans are being attacked and ransacked before they can deliver their goods. Escort them safely to their destination and bring an end to this thuggery.
The locals of a nearby village live in constant fear of attacks from raiders. The village elder has requested "hired thugs" to protect the townsfolk.

Locals have been going missing under mysterious circumstances. First it was a a disappearance here and there at night, but now entire villages are vanishing in broad daylight. Hunt down whatever is behind these disappearances and slay them. Gods willing, we might be able to rescue some of the missing townsfolk.
A local fortification has been taken and their garrison wiped out. We have sent a relief force, but coupled with your army we have a good chance to scour this blighted place.
It pays well, we can spare the time
We have more important matters to attend to
This should give Dietrich time to find us better work
We have more important matters to attend to
Listen to the silence, something has frightened even the animals speechless
We have more important matters to attend to
We will cleanse it with gunpowder and steel
We have more important matters to attend to
A travelling Wizard fears he is being stalked, he says they are after an object he has recently dicovered and it is imperative it remains in his hands at all cost.

A flight of dragons have made a nest nearby. After much devastation and the destruction of local forces trying to drive them off, an army has been sent to deal with the beasts. The commander has approached us wishing to bolster their forces, and they tell us that the dragons have apparently amassed quite the hoard of treasure. Should we help them, the commander tells us that this trove is ours for the taking. Provided we slay the dragons, of course.
A logistical error has left a garrison severly depleted. The garrison commander has asked us to join rank until a relief force arrives.

A known collaborator with the forces of darkness has escaped his prison cell aided by his followers. We've been tasked with tracking him down and bringing him back dead or alive, preferably the former. Local forces will join us and take him into custody immediately for interrogation. If he survives, that is.

A large enemy force has gained the attention of the local ruler. They have sent out an army to vanquish these foes, but we've received word that they need us to shore up their forces. We will be handsomely rewarded should we provide them aid.
We have more important matters to attend to
We have more important matters to attend to
How hard can babysitting an Outpost be
We have more important matters to attend to
This notorious criminal will be brought to justice
We have more important matters to attend to
We will cleanse it with gunpowder and steel
We have more important matters to attend to

A nest of ratmen has been found nearby. We've been tasked with putting it to the torch and slaying the foul creatures that reside within. On top of the regular payment they will pay us 12 crowns per head, and anything of value found in the nest is ours to keep.

A cloaked messenger approaches. They tell of a nearby necromancer who has found a powerful artifact used to resurrect the dead. We are tasked with killing the necromancer and destroying the artifact. The cloaked figure disappears into the night, leaving us with the promise of great rewards.
A traveling trader has wandered into our camp and wishes to show off his wares.
We have crossed paths with a trade caravan. Realising we mean them no harm, the wagon master has invited us to trade.
A small trading outpost is just up ahead. Perhaps we may find something of value there.
Empty the store wagon, we’ll need to fill it with Rat heads.
We have more important matters to attend to
Put them back in their graves
We have more important matters to attend to
There is nothing of note here
There is nothing of note here
There is nothing of note here

A small army has been sent to repulse an invading band of Trolls, short of troops the commander has given us the following proposition ‘Help us spill their black blood and we will see your coffers overflow’.
A Greenskin camp has been spotted nearby. We should give them a taste of their own medicine and take their spoils for ourselves.
We have more important matters to attend to
We can always use more coin
We have more important matters to attend to
We have more important matters to attend to

A local brewery needs assistance in repelling a band of drunken giants. The guards have all been recently conscripted into the army, leaving the brewery virtually defenseless. If we can drive them away, we'll each receive a keg of beer along with our typical fee. We cannot allow the beer to be wasted on these ignorant giants.
Whatever the price, we have mouths to feed
A money lender approaches our camp. After opening a large chest of shimmering gold, he says, "I heard you're low on funds. Do you want a loan? Our price is fair."

Men ready yourselves for battle, the taste of fear is on your lips. I say spit out the fear, drive out the fear with bloodlust. Give no quarter, no pity, no mercy, slay and slay again and you might live.
Important it may be, but time is precious and while these lands may fall we ensure that order remains steadfast.

A huge swarm of enemies floods across the borders, hellbent on the destruction of everything in their wake. The combined armies of the surrounding regions have been sent to repel them, but even still, they find themselves severely outnumbered. They have asked for our assistance in this desperate hour.\\n\\nIf we refuse, the enemy will surely bring ruin to these lands. Be under no illusion: This is no mere raid. This is an invasion that may well be the last stand for many of these people.
